item.title: This Detroit startup is turning to utilities to make home efficiency upgrades cheaper
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Investors have bought into Pearl Edison's idea and recently poured $3 .3 million into the startup.

item.title: Vast Data in talks with Alphabet’s CapitalG, Nvidia to fund round at up to $30B valuation
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The round could make the AI data storage company one of the most valuable in the world.

item.title: Authorities seize BlackSuit ransomware gang’s servers
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: German authorities said they have seized the servers used by the long-running ransomware gang, BlackSuit, which is blamed for cyberattacks across Europe and the U.S., including the City of Dallas.

item.title: Klarna might reschedule its IPO for September
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Details are slim, though, regarding when Klarna will schedule its debut; no final decisions have been made.

item.title: VC industry has become a better career for women over the past 7 years
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: All Raise released a report that said 18.6% of the top roles at leading VC firms are held by women, which is double what it was in 2018.

item.title: Reddit plans to unify its search interface as it looks to become a search engine
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Reddit is working on a new unified interface that will merge its legacy search and AI-powered Q&A features, as well as make its search box more prominently visible in the app.

item.title: Joby Aviation and defense contractor L3Harris to test autonomous hybrid aircraft
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Joby's years of R&D with the DoD may be paying off. The company has signed an agreement with defense contractor L3Harris to develop a gas-turbine hybrid VTOL that can fly autonomously — for defense applications.

item.title: Google rolls out Gemini Deep Think AI, a reasoning model that tests multiple ideas in parallel
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Google released its first publicly available "multi-agent" AI system, which uses more computational resources, but produces better answers.

item.title: Handwave lends a hand to retailers with its European alternative to Amazon’s palm payments
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Latvian startup Handwave aims to compete with Amazon palm payments by offering an independent alternative.

item.title: Female-founded semiconductor AI startup SixSense raises $8.5M
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: SixSense offers an AI-powered platform that helps chip makers prevent defects. It landed backing led by Peak XV’s Surge (formerly Sequoia India & SEA).

item.title: Amazon CEO wants to put ads in your Alexa+ conversations
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Andy Jassy's description of an AI-generated ad that Alexa+ delivers in a multistep conversation, which could help users find new products, is uncharted territory for Amazon and the broader tech industry.

item.title: Apple projects tariff costs will hit $1.1B next quarter
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: While sales growth suggests fear of tariffs helped fuel sales, Cook downplayed the “pull forward” effect, noting that consumers were more motivated by the “strength of the product.”

item.title: Reddit revenue soars as it bets on AI and advertising
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Reddit reported its Q2 earnings, and it’s clear that its focus on AI has ramped up significantly.

item.title: Apple has now sold 3 billion iPhones
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: The rate of iPhone sales growth has accelerated too. This uptick in sales might be temporary, though.

item.title: Apple plans to ‘significantly’ grow AI investments, Cook says
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple is open to M&A to accelerate its AI strategy, and says it's made seven acquisitions this year so far.

item.title: Iconiq’s Will Griffith explains how his firm celebrated Figma’s IPO and why investors sold shares
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Will Griffith is a seed investor in Figma. Investors didn't want to sell millions of shares. He explains why they did it anyway.

item.title: Enterprises prefer Anthropic’s AI models over anyone else’s, including OpenAI’s
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Anthropic holds 32% of enterprise LLM market share by usage. This is a sharp reversal from just two years ago when OpenAI held 50%.

item.title: Twitter’s former Trust and Safety head details the challenges facing decentralized social platforms
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Yoel Roth shares concerns about the open social web's ability to combat misinformation, spam, and other illegal content.

item.title: The sequel to ‘The Social Network’ may have just found its lead actors
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: While the 2010 original film focused on Mark Zuckerberg's rise, “Social Network Part II” is said to draw from Jeff Horwitz's “The Facebook Files,” which exposed Facebook's harmful effects on teens and its role in spreading misinformation.

item.title: Your public ChatGPT queries are getting indexed by Google and other search engines
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Search engines are indexing links to ChatGPT conversations that have been made sharable with a link.
